Iwan Bule Jadi Ketua Umum PSSI, Begini Respons Presiden FIFA
02 Nov 2019, 09:19 by Antara, Nurdin Saleh
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Presiden badan sepak bola dunia (FIFA) Gianni Infantino optimistis sepak bola Indonesia akan bangkit di bawah kepemimpinan Ketua Umum Persatuan Sepakbola Seluruh Indonesia (PSSI) terpilih periode 2019-2023, Mochamad Iriawan atau yang akrab disapa Iwan Bule.
Hal tersebut disampaikan oleh Gianni kepada Sekjen PSSI Ratu Tisha Destria melalui sambungan telpon tepat seusai Kongres Luar Biasa (KLB) PSSI di Hotel Shangri-La, Jakarta digelar.
“Saya mengucapkan selamat dan saya menaruh harapan besar di bawah kepemimpinan Anda, sepak bola Indonesia akan bangkit," ujar Gianni seperti dikutip keterangan resmi yang diterima di Jakarta, Sabtu.
Gianni juga mengatakan dirinya akan segera mengagendakan untuk datang ke Indonesia dan bertatap muka secara langsung dengan Ketum PSSI terpilih itu.
Iwan Bule pun mengaku senang atas apresiasi yang disampaikan oleh Presiden FIFA tersebut. “Terima kasih. Kami sangat berharap dan mendapat kehormatan kalau Anda bisa berkunjung,” ucap Iwan.
Ucapan selamat dari FIFA juga sampaikan oleh Sesmenpora Gatot S Dewa Broto yang juga hadir di kongres bersama dengan Menpora Zainudin Amali serta Ketua KOI Raja Sapta Oktohari.
"Bahkan seusai terpilih, Iwan Bule langsung memperoleh ucapan selamat via call langsung dari Presiden FIFA Giani Infantino (yang sedang berada di Bangkok karena sore ini akan bertemu dengan Presiden Jokowi yang sedang menghadiri KTT ASEAN) melalui gadgetnya Sekjen PSSI Ratu Tisha," kata Gatot dalam keterangan resminya.
Pada KLB PSSI, Iwan Bule terpilish sebagai ketua dengan meraih 82 suara dari 86 suara. Dia mengalahkan dua kandidat lainnya, yakni Rahim Soekasah dan Arif Putra Wicaksono.
text:
Iwan Bule Becomes PSSI General Chair, Here's the FIFA President's Response
02 Nov 2019, 09:19 by Antara, Nurdin Saleh
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The president of the world soccer body (FIFA) Gianni Infantino is optimistic that Indonesian football will rise under the leadership of the Chairperson of the All Indonesian Football Association (PSSI) elected in 2019-2023, Mochamad Iriawan or familiarly called Iwan Bule.
This was conveyed by Gianni to PSSI Secretary General Ratu Tisha Destria via telephone line right after the PSSI Extraordinary Congress (KLB) at the Shangri-La Hotel, Jakarta.
"I congratulate and I have great hopes under your leadership that Indonesian football will rise," Gianni was quoted as saying in an official statement received in Jakarta on Saturday.
Gianni also said he would soon schedule to come to Indonesia and meet face to face with the elected PSSI Chairman.
Iwan Bule also claimed to be happy for the appreciation delivered by the FIFA President. "Thank you. We really hope and have the honor if you can visit, "said Iwan.
Congratulations from FIFA were also conveyed by Sesmenpora Gatot S Dewa Broto who was also present at the congress along with Menpora Zainudin Amali and KOI Chairman Raja Sapta Oktohari.
"Even after being elected, Iwan Bule immediately received congratulations via a direct call from FIFA President Giani Infantino (who was in Bangkok because this afternoon will meet with President Jokowi who was attending the ASEAN Summit) through his gadget PSSI Secretary General Ratu Tisha," Gatot said official statement.
At the PSSI KLB, Iwan Bule was elected as chairman by gaining 82 votes from 86 votes. He defeated two other candidates, namely Rahim Soekasah and Arif Putra Wicaksono.
